answers.answer: I'll comment to get your question back to the top.IHang in there. Don't give up on finding help.

Do you know what your calcium and pth levels were?  You can have high calcium with a normal pth and still have hyperparathyroidism.  It is called inappropriately normal.  You can check on parathyroid.com.I have been battling many symptoms for 14 months and have been told also that I do not have hyperparathyroid disease, until my calcium came up high again, and I pushed the issue, and we are rechecking.  I have sinus tachy too.  Do you take any medication for it?  I take toprol xl.  Some days it helps and other days it does not.My calcium has been all over the board from 9.8 up to 11.0.  I was even told that 11.0 was not high until I found a new physician.  I have still not been diagnosed with the disease, but I am trying to get to the bottom of why I am having all of these problems.  Do you have any other symptoms also?mmee

question: Apart from infection, hyperthyroidism, hyperparathyroidism, diabetes, pheochromocytoma, autoimmune disease and hormone imbalance (as all have been ruled out).  What else can cause sustained sinus tachycardia?
title: Sustained sinus tachy
